page.title: 08HOUSES
page.content: Tewkesbury's character lies with the black and white buildings of the town and the many Alleys which join one street to another. Most of the timber framed buildings have a preservation order on them and are all classed as listed buildings. Although a lot of these buildings have now become business premises,they still retain that 'Olde Worlde' feeling that draws the many tourists to Tewkesbury each year. As mentioned,helping to retain this character,we have the numerous Alleys and several antique shops.Each individual Alley is steeped in history: such as Lilley's Alley which once contained a malthouse and was a place where clay pipes were put on racks to dry.
